title: Football at the 2007 All-Africa Games – Women's tournament
text:
The 2007 All-Africa Games football – Women's tournament was the 2nd edition of the <a href="Football%20at%20the%20All-Africa%20Games">African Games men's football tournament</a> for women. The <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament was held in <a href="Algiers">Algiers</a>, <a href="Algeria">Algeria</a> in July 2007 as part of the <a href="2007%20All-Africa%20Games">2007 All-Africa Games</a>.
Six teams took part. The final was a repeat of the first one four years ago. Nigeria again beat South Africa.
Qualification.
Algeria (hosts), Nigeria and Ghana qualified automatically. Cameroon and Mozambique withdrew. Teams that qualified for the tournament were:
Final tournament.
"All times given as local time (<a href="UTC%2B1">UTC+1</a>)"
The top two teams advanced. Ethiopia and Senegal were eliminated.
Group stage.
Group A.
Group A consisted of Ethiopia, Nigeria and South Africa.
Group B.
Group B consisted of Algeria, Ghana and Senegal.
